analyzed: mtshan ('phrog byed rjes su lha/) nyid dang 'di ltar gyur ba dang bgo skal dang zlos pa rnams la pra ti pa ri aa nu rnams las so //

analyzed: ha ri ma nu /

original: 'di ltar gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa la /

original: lakshm'i:ha ri ma nu /
analyzed: lakshm'i:ha ri ma nu /

analyzed: de'i don la bzhi pa brjod do //

analyzed: de'i don zhes pa don shin tu bzang ba bsgrubs na myur du 'grub nges pa da lta mngon du ma gyur pa zhig la zer la don de la bzhi pa 'gyur te /

original: dper brjod 'grel par tshigs bcad du byung ba ni /
analyzed: dper brjod 'grel par tshigs bcad du byung ba ni /

analyzed: sam (brgya yis yongs su nyos pa rjes su smros/) ya m'a ya shru tam dhante na ro dharm'a ya sam ya mam /

analyzed: dharmam moksh'a ya me dh'a b'i dha nam d'a n'a ya bhukta ye /

analyzed: yang 'grel par lung drangs (sdom brtson ched du thos pa 'dzin //

analyzed: kri y'artho pa pa da sya tsa karma ni sth'a ni na:/

original: bya ba'i don gyi nye ba'i tshig la'ang las la'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i don gyi nye ba'i tshig la'ang las la'o //

original: pha le bhyo y'a ti /

original: y'a g'a ya y'a ti /

original: bh'i tv'arth'a n'am bha ya he tu:/
analyzed: bh'i tv'arth'a n'am bha ya he tu:/
translated: Bhītarthānāṃ bhayahṛt.🔽For those whose purpose is fear, it is the ablative.

original: 'jigs pa dang bsrung ba'i don rnams kyi (grong las 'ongs so//
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bsrung ba'i don rnams kyi (grong las 'ongs so//
translated: (He came from the village.)

original: bang brgyugs pa'i rta las lhung ngo//) 'jigs pa'i rgyu la'o //
analyzed: bang brgyugs pa'i rta las lhung ngo//) 'jigs pa'i rgyu la'o //
translated: In the cause of fear.

original: 'jigs pa'i don dang bsrung ba'i don rnams kyi sbyor ba las 'jigs pa'i rgyu la yang lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i don dang bsrung ba'i don rnams kyi sbyor ba las 'jigs pa'i rgyu la yang lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: In the cause of fear, the fifth case is used in the sense of the object of fear and the object of protection.

original: (sdig pa las phrag dog byed /
analyzed: (sdig pa las phrag dog byed /
translated: [He is jealous of sin.]

original: sdig pa las dga' ba dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdig pa las dga' ba dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: [He is separated from joy in sin.]

original: chos las mi 'os pa byed/) tsoo r'a dvi bhe ti /
analyzed: chos las mi 'os pa byed/) tsoo r'a dvi bhe ti /
translated: [He does what is improper with regard to the Dharma.]🔽Caurādvayabheti.

original: tsoo r'attr'a ya te /
analyzed: tsoo r'attr'a ya te /
translated: Caurāttarayate.

original: pa r'a dze ra so dha:/
analyzed: pa r'a dze ra so dha:/
translated: Parāje rasodhaḥ.

original: rgyal ba ma yin pa'i 'pham pa la'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba ma yin pa'i 'pham pa la'o //
translated: In the defeat of the non-victorious.

original: gang rgyal ba ma yin pa'i 'pham pa'i don sbyor pa la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang rgyal ba ma yin pa'i 'pham pa'i don sbyor pa la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: In the sense of the defeat of the non-victorious, the fifth case is used.

original: p'a p'atpa r'a dza ya te /🔽b'a ra n'arth'a n'a m'ipsi ta:/
analyzed: p'a p'atpa r'a dza ya te / b'a ra n'arth'a n'a m'ipsi ta:/
translated: Pāpātparājayate.🔽Varaṇārthānāmipsitaḥ.

original: spangs pa'i don rnams kyi 'dod pa la'o //🔽gang spangs pa'i don rnams la de spang bar (chom rkun las 'jigs so /
analyzed: spangs pa'i don rnams kyi 'dod pa la'o // gang spangs pa'i don rnams la de spang bar (chom rkun las 'jigs so /
translated: In the desire for the objects of abandonment.

original: chom rkun las bsrung ngo/) 'dod pa la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: chom rkun las bsrung ngo/) 'dod pa la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: In the desire for the objects of abandonment, the fifth case is used.

original: ya bi bhyo g'a:b'ar ya ti /
analyzed: ya bi bhyo g'a:b'ar ya ti /
translated: Yavibhyogāḥ paryāyate.

original: aantardhoo ye n'a darsha na mi tsha ti /🔽gang gis mi mthong bar (sdig pa las 'pham par 'gyur/) byed pa'i sbed pa la'o //
analyzed: aantardhoo ye n'a darsha na mi tsha ti / gang gis mi mthong bar (sdig pa las 'pham par 'gyur/) byed pa'i sbed pa la'o //
translated: antardhānaṃ yena nādṛṣṭiścamatkṛtiḥ.🔽In the sense of hiding what is not seen.

original: gang gis mi mthong bar 'dod pa'i sbed pa'i don sbyor ba la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis mi mthong bar 'dod pa'i sbed pa'i don sbyor ba la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: In the sense of the hiding of what is desired not to be seen, the fifth case is used.

original: m'a turni l'i ya te krishna:/🔽a'a khy'a to pa yo ge /🔽klog pa dang nye bar sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: m'a turni l'i ya te krishna:/ a'a khy'a to pa yo ge / klog pa dang nye bar sbyor ba la'o //
translated: māturnilayate kṛṣṇaḥ.🔽ākhyātopyayogāt.🔽In the sense of reading and application.

original: slob (nas rnams las ba lang rnams zlog par byed/) pa'i don nye bar sbyor ba'i klog pa'i sgra sbyor ba la yang lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob (nas rnams las ba lang rnams zlog par byed/) pa'i don nye bar sbyor ba'i klog pa'i sgra sbyor ba la yang lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: In the sense of the application of reading, the fifth case is used.

original: au p'a dhy'a y'a da dh'i te ba tu:/
analyzed: au p'a dhy'a y'a da dh'i te ba tu:/
translated: upādhyāyādaddhite bataḥ.

original: slob pa'i don nye bar sbyor ba ma yin na lnga pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob pa'i don nye bar sbyor ba ma yin na lnga pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not in the sense of application of learning, the fifth case is not used.

original: na ta sya g'i (nag po ma las yib par byed/) t'am shr'i no ti/...(gar mkhan gyi glu thos par 'gyur/) dza ni kartu:pra kri ti /
analyzed: na ta sya g'i (nag po ma las yib par byed/) t'am shr'i no ti/...(gar mkhan gyi glu thos par 'gyur/) dza ni kartu:pra kri ti /
translated: na tasya gītaṃ śṛṇoti janaḥ kartuprakṛtau.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: In the sense of the nature of the producer.

original: rang bzhin te rgyu gang gi 'bras bu'am dngos po bskyed (mkhan po las klog par byed slob ma/) par byas zin pa'i rgyu la lnga pa @104a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin te rgyu gang gi 'bras bu'am dngos po bskyed (mkhan po las klog par byed slob ma/) par byas zin pa'i rgyu la lnga pa @104a * //
translated: The fifth case is used for the cause of the nature of the result or thing that is produced.

original: 'jug ste / brahma na:pra dz'a:pra dz'a yante /
analyzed: 'jug ste / brahma na:pra dz'a:pra dz'a yante /
translated: Brahmāḥ prajāḥ prajāyante.

original: bhu ba:pra bha ba:/
analyzed: bhu ba:pra bha ba:/
translated: Bhūḥ prabhavaty aṇḍāt.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba las so //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba las so //
translated: It arises from the source.

original: gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: The fifth case is used for the source of what arises.

original: hi ma ba to gam g'a pra bha ba ti /
analyzed: hi ma ba to gam g'a pra bha ba ti /
translated: Himāvataḥ kāmāḥ prabhavanti.

original: 'grel par / lyapa phyis pa la gnyis pa dang bdun pa'i don la lnga pa'o zhes pa byung bas ;
analyzed: 'grel par / lyapa phyis pa la gnyis pa dang bdun pa'i don la lnga pa'o zhes pa byung bas ;

analyzed: a'a sa (gangs can las gam g'a 'byung bar byed/) n'atpreksha te /

analyzed: yang 'grel par lung drangs pa /

original: prashn'a khy'a na yoshtsa /
analyzed: prashn'a khy'a na yoshtsa /

analyzed: aa n+y'a r'a di ta rarte dika shabd'anyts'utta ra pa d'a dz'a hi yukte /

analyzed: aa n+ya a'a r'ata ai ta ra ri te phyogs kyi sgra aanytsu rnams kyi phyi ma'i tshig dang a'atsa a'a hi dag gi sbyor ba la'o //

translated: When these such as anya are combined with words of the latter, and āha has a final suffix, the fifth case is used.

original: aa n+ya:krishn'ata / bhinno r'a m'ata /🔽a'a r'ata r'a m'ata /
analyzed: aa n+ya:krishn'ata / bhinno r'a m'ata / a'a r'ata r'a m'ata /

original: ai ta ro r'a m'ata /
analyzed: ai ta ro r'a m'ata /

original: ri te buddh'a ta ku to moksh'ata /
analyzed: ri te buddh'a ta ku to moksh'ata /

original: p'urbogr'a m'ata / aa ya masm'ata p'urba:/
analyzed: p'urbogr'a m'ata / aa ya masm'ata p'urba:/
translated: ayamasmin pūrvaḥ, this one is earlier than that.

original: pr'a ka gr'a m'ata /🔽dakshi n'a gr'a m'ata /
analyzed: pr'a ka gr'a m'ata / dakshi n'a gr'a m'ata /
translated: prāka grāmāt, from the village.🔽dakṣiṇā grāmāt, from the southern village.

original: dakshi n'a hi gr'a m'ata /
analyzed: dakshi n'a hi gr'a m'ata /
translated: dakṣiṇā ha grāmāt, from the southern village.

original: yang 'grel par /
analyzed: yang 'grel par /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary,

original: snga ma'i don sbyor ba las skabs 'gar lnga pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: snga ma'i don sbyor ba las skabs 'gar lnga pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /
translated: it is explained that from the meaning of the former, sometimes the fifth case is used.

original: bha b'a d'a (nag po gzhan /🔽dga' byed las gzhan /🔽dga' byed las nye ba /
analyzed: bha b'a d'a (nag po gzhan / dga' byed las gzhan / dga' byed las nye ba /
translated: bhavād, from you.🔽rāman, from the beloved.🔽rāman, from the beloved one.

original: dga' byed las cig shos /
analyzed: dga' byed las cig shos /
translated: rāman, from the beloved.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bor bas ci phyir grol shar gyi grong las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bor bas ci phyir grol shar gyi grong las /
translated: Why is it called “buddha-field”?

original: 'di nged las snga ma /
analyzed: 'di nged las snga ma /
translated: It is earlier than we are.

original: grong las shar /
analyzed: grong las shar /
translated: It is earlier than the town.

original: ra bhya:/...'khor ba las snga ma /
analyzed: ra bhya:/...'khor ba las snga ma /
translated: It is earlier than saṃsāra.🔽In the commentary, the word “town” is explained as meaning external objects, like the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

original: lho phyogs kyi grong/) yang 'grel par grong gi phyi lta bu phyi'i don sbyor ba la lnga pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /🔽gr'a m'a dva hi:/...(grong las phyi/) aa pa pa r'i bardza ne /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi grong/) yang 'grel par grong gi phyi lta bu phyi'i don sbyor ba la lnga pa 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas / gr'a m'a dva hi:/...(grong las phyi/) aa pa pa r'i bardza ne /
translated: The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

original: aa pa pa ri dag gi bor ba la'o //
analyzed: aa pa pa ri dag gi bor ba la'o //
translated: The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

analyzed: aa pa pa ri dag sbyor ba bor @104b ba brjod pa la las rab tu sbyor ba zhes ming 'dogs byed do // a'ang mar++y++y'a d'a ba tsa ne /
translated: The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

original: a'ang las mtshams brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: a'ang las mtshams brjod pa la'o //
translated: The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.🔽The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

original: a'ang las mtshams lta bu bar mtshams bzung ba'i don brjod pa la yang las rab tu sbyor ba zhes dgos pa'i dbang gis ming 'dogs byed do //
analyzed: a'ang las mtshams lta bu bar mtshams bzung ba'i don brjod pa la yang las rab tu sbyor ba zhes dgos pa'i dbang gis ming 'dogs byed do //
translated: The word “outside” is used for the outside of a town.

original: panytsa mya a'ang pa ri bhi:aa pa a'ang ba ri rnams kyi lnga pa'o //
analyzed: panytsa mya a'ang pa ri bhi:aa pa a'ang ba ri rnams kyi lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth of the Pañcāṅga, Aṅgaparī, and Aparapari.

original: aa pa la sogs pa 'di rnams gong du las rab tu sbyor ba zhes ming 'dogs byas pa'i don de dag dang sbyor ba la rnam dbye gnyis pa'i don la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: aa pa la sogs pa 'di rnams gong du las rab tu sbyor ba zhes ming 'dogs byas pa'i don de dag dang sbyor ba la rnam dbye gnyis pa'i don la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: These Aparas, etc., are to be combined with the meaning of the word karma, which was previously designated as “employment.” In the sense of the second case, the fifth case is formed.

original: aa pa ha re:sam s'a re:/
analyzed: aa pa ha re:sam s'a re:/
translated: Aparah, samsāraḥ,

original: pa ri ha re:sam s'a ra:/
analyzed: pa ri ha re:sam s'a ra:/
translated: parah, samsāraḥ,

original: a'a mukte ssam s'a ra:/
analyzed: a'a mukte ssam s'a ra:/
translated: amuktaḥ, samsāraḥ,

original: pra ti:/ pra ti ni dhi pra ti d'a na yo:/
analyzed: pra ti:/ pra ti ni dhi pra ti d'a na yo:/
translated: prati, prati-nidhi-prati-dāne ca.

original: pra ti 'gran pa dang brje ba dag la'o //
analyzed: pra ti 'gran pa dang brje ba dag la'o //
translated: Prati is used in the sense of “rivalry” and “exchange.”

original: pra ti sbyor ba 'gran pa dang brje ba dag la 'jug pa'i tshe las rab tu brjod pa zhes ming 'dogs byed do //
analyzed: pra ti sbyor ba 'gran pa dang brje ba dag la 'jug pa'i tshe las rab tu brjod pa zhes ming 'dogs byed do //
translated: When prati is used in the sense of “rivalry” and “exchange,” it is designated as “employment of karma.”

original: pra ti ni dhi pra ti d'a ne tsa yasm'ata /🔽gang ('khor ba las 'phrog byed bral /🔽'khor ba las so sor 'phrog byed bral /
analyzed: pra ti ni dhi pra ti d'a ne tsa yasm'ata / gang ('khor ba las 'phrog byed bral / 'khor ba las so sor 'phrog byed bral /
translated: Prati-nidhi-prati-dāne ca yasmāt.

original: 'khor ba las grol ba'i bar du/) las 'gran pa dang brje ba la'ang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba las grol ba'i bar du/) las 'gran pa dang brje ba la'ang ngo //
translated: [It is used] in the sense of “rivalry” and “exchange” with regard to samsara.

original: pra tv'i sbyor ba gang las 'gran ba dang brje ba'i don brjod ba gong du las rab tu brjod pa zhes mi 'dogs byas pa de la rnam dbye gnyis pa'i don la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: pra tv'i sbyor ba gang las 'gran ba dang brje ba'i don brjod ba gong du las rab tu brjod pa zhes mi 'dogs byas pa de la rnam dbye gnyis pa'i don la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: The second case is used for the meaning of the fifth case in that which was previously called “the expression of action.”

original: aa bhi ma n+yu rardzun ta:pra ti /
analyzed: aa bhi ma n+yu rardzun ta:pra ti /
translated: avabhīmanyurarduntapratī

original: m'a sh'a na smee ti le bhya:pra ti yatstsha ti /🔽aa kartar++yri ne panytsa m'i /🔽byed pa po med pa la bu lon la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: m'a sh'a na smee ti le bhya:pra ti yatstsha ti / aa kartar++yri ne panytsa m'i / byed pa po med pa la bu lon la lnga pa'o //
translated: māṣānāṃ meti lebhyaḥ pratīyacca🔽akartari ne pañcamāḥ🔽The fifth case is used for debt in the absence of an agent.

original: bu lon gyi rgyu las byed pa po med pa de la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: bu lon gyi rgyu las byed pa po med pa de la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: The fifth case is used for that which is without an agent in the cause of debt.

original: sha t'a dvaddha:/ bi bh'a sh'a gu ne& stri y'am /
analyzed: sha t'a dvaddha:/ bi bh'a sh'a gu ne& stri y'am /
translated: śatāvadhyāḥ

analyzed: bud med ma yin pa la yon tan la yang na'o // cho ga'i yan (srid sgrub las so sor 'gran par byed /
translated: vibhāṣāguṇe’pi striyāṃ🔽The fifth case is used for the cause of the quality that is in the hand in the absence of the sign of a woman.

original: sran ma 'di dang til rnams so sor brje/) lag tu gyur pa'i yon tan gyi rgyu la bud med kyi rtags ma yin pa la lnga pa yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: sran ma 'di dang til rnams so sor brje/) lag tu gyur pa'i yon tan gyi rgyu la bud med kyi rtags ma yin pa la lnga pa yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The fifth case is used for the cause of the quality that is in the hand in the absence of the sign of a woman.

original: dz'a dy'a dvaddha:/ dz'a dye na baddha:/
analyzed: dz'a dy'a dvaddha:/ dz'a dye na baddha:/
translated: jāyād yāvad dṛḍhaḥ🔽jāyena badhyate

original: yon (brgya thams pas bcings/) tan gyi yan lag yin na mi 'gyur te /

original: (ba rnams 'jo ba la song/) / gang las aa dhi sbyor ba gang gi'ang dbang phyug gi don brjod pa las rab tu brjod pa zhes ming 'dogs byas pa de la bdun pa 'gyur te /

original: aa dhi bhu bi r'a ma:/

original: shashth'its'a n'a da re ;

original: ma gus pa la drug pa yang na'o //

analyzed: gang gi bya ba'i bar gyi rtags de las ma gus pa brjod pa la drug pa dang bdun pa'ang ngo //

analyzed: ru da ti pr'a br'a dz'ita/...(ngu zhing song/)...ru da ta:pr'a br'a dz'i ta /

analyzed: dha na sya a'i shvara:/ de she aa dhi pa ti:/

analyzed: de sha sya aa dhi pa ti / bho ge d'a y'a da /

analyzed: dha na sya pra ti bh'u / ga bam pra s'u ta /

analyzed: go shu pra s'u ta /

original: a'a yukta ku sha l'a bhy'am b'a se b'a y'am /
analyzed: a'a yukta ku sha l'a bhy'am b'a se b'a y'am /

original: (chos kyi rje /
analyzed: (chos kyi rje /

original: chos kyi rje/) a'a yukta ku sha (nor gyi dbang phyug/) la dag gi mchod pa la (yul gyi bdag po/) yang na'o /
analyzed: chos kyi rje/) a'a yukta ku sha (nor gyi dbang phyug/) la dag gi mchod pa la (yul gyi bdag po/) yang na'o /

original: (/ longs spyod bgo skal/) a'a yukta dang ku sha la (nor gyi dbang po/) dag gi mchod pa'i (nor gyi gnya' bo/) don brjod pa dang / (ba lang gi be'u/) sbyor ba la drug pa dang bdun pa yang na ste /🔽a'a yukta:ha ri p'u dza ne /

original: a'a yukta:ha ri p'u dza na sya /🔽ku sha la:ha ri p'u dza ne /
analyzed: a'a yukta:ha ri p'u dza na sya / ku sha la:ha ri p'u dza ne /

original: ku sha la:ha ri p'u dza na sya /🔽ya tashtsa nirdh'a ra n'am /
analyzed: ku sha la:ha ri p'u dza na sya / ya tashtsa nirdh'a ra n'am /

original: gang las kyang nges par bkar ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang las kyang nges par bkar ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: yatścānirdeśanām

original: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas gzhan las nges par bkar ba ste nges par bzung ba'i don la drug ('phrog byed la mchod pa kun du sbyor bar byed/) pa dang bdun pa rnams ('phrog byed la dge bar mchod par byed/) 'gyur te🔽/ nri n'am dvi dza:shreshtha /
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas gzhan las nges par bkar ba ste nges par bzung ba'i don la drug ('phrog byed la mchod pa kun du sbyor bar byed/) pa dang bdun pa rnams ('phrog byed la dge bar mchod par byed/) 'gyur te / nri n'am dvi dza:shreshtha /
translated: 1. The definite article is used to indicate a particular thing from among a class of things, such as a particular caste, quality, action, and so on.🔽Nṛṇām dvijaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ.

original: nri shu dvi dza: shreshtha:/🔽ga b'am krishn'a goo:ba hu ksh'i r'a /
analyzed: nri shu dvi dza: shreshtha:/ ga b'am krishn'a goo:ba hu ksh'i r'a /

original: go shu krishn'a goo:ba hu ksh'i r'a /
analyzed: go shu krishn'a goo:ba hu ksh'i r'a /
translated: Goḥ kṛṣṇāgauraḥ.

original: yang 'grel par dper brjod tshigs bcad du byung ba ni /
analyzed: yang 'grel par dper brjod tshigs bcad du byung ba ni /
translated: The verse example in the commentary is:

original: pu ru sh'a n'am kshattri ya:/🔽sh'u ra: shy'a m'a n'a r'i n'am darsha n'i y'a /🔽gatstsha t'am dh'a banta sh'i ghra:/
analyzed: pu ru sh'a n'am kshattri ya:/ sh'u ra: shy'a m'a n'a r'i n'am darsha n'i y'a / gatstsha t'am dh'a banta sh'i ghra:/
translated: Puruṣāṇāṃ kṣatriyo yathā,🔽śūro ’śvamedhāriṇāṃ darśanīyaḥ.

original: dharma sh'i t'a n'am shraddh'a gr'a:/
analyzed: dharma sh'i t'a n'am shraddh'a gr'a:/
translated: Gacchato dhāvanto ’pi śaṅkhasya,🔽dharmasīṭānāṃ śraddhāgṛhaḥ.

original: de rnams drug pa'i (mi rnams kyi gnyis skyes mchog/) a'ama (mi rnams la gnyis skyes mchog /
analyzed: de rnams drug pa'i (mi rnams kyi gnyis skyes mchog/) a'ama (mi rnams la gnyis skyes mchog /
translated: These six are:

original: ba lang rnams kyi ba nag mo 'o ma mang /
analyzed: ba lang rnams kyi ba nag mo 'o ma mang /
translated: The black cows have much milk.🔽The black cows have much milk.

original: ba lang rnams la ba nag mo 'o ma mang/) dang / yang na bdun (skyes bu rnams kyi rgyal rigs dpa' //
analyzed: ba lang rnams la ba nag mo 'o ma mang/) dang / yang na bdun (skyes bu rnams kyi rgyal rigs dpa' //
translated: Or, the seven:🔽Among men, the warrior is the best.

original: bud med rnams kyi sngo bsangs mdzes //
analyzed: bud med rnams kyi sngo bsangs mdzes //
translated: Among women, the dark one is lovely.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyug pa mgyogs //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyug pa mgyogs //
translated: Among beings, the runner is swift.

original: chos dkar rnams kyi dad pa mchog/) / pa'i su ba sbyar bas /🔽pu ru she shu kshattri ya:/
analyzed: chos dkar rnams kyi dad pa mchog/) / pa'i su ba sbyar bas / pu ru she shu kshattri ya:/
translated: Among the white dharmas, faith is supreme.

original: sh'u r'a: shy'a m'a n'a r'i shu darsha n'i y'a/...(bud med rnams la sngo bsangs mdzes/) / gatstshat+su dh'a banta sh'i ghra:/...('gro ba rnams la rgyug pa mgyogs/) / dharma shi te shu shraddh'agr'a:/...(chos dkar rnams la dad pa mchog /) / zhes pa tshig rkang dang po rigs las dkar🔽ba / gnyis pa yon tan /
analyzed: sh'u r'a: shy'a m'a n'a r'i shu darsha n'i y'a/...(bud med rnams la sngo bsangs mdzes/) / gatstshat+su dh'a banta sh'i ghra:/...('gro ba rnams la rgyug pa mgyogs/) / dharma shi te shu shraddh'agr'a:/...(chos dkar rnams la dad pa mchog /) / zhes pa tshig rkang dang po rigs las dkar ba / gnyis pa yon tan /
translated: The first line shows the white class.

original: gsum pa dang (skyes bu rnams la rgyal rigs dpa' //
analyzed: gsum pa dang (skyes bu rnams la rgyal rigs dpa' //
translated: The second shows the qualities.🔽The third shows the action.

original: ) @109a * //  bzhi pas bya ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: ) @109a * //  bzhi pas bya ba ston pa'o //
translated: The fourth shows the agent.

original: panytsa m'i bi bhakte /🔽rnam par gus pa la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: panytsa m'i bi bhakte / rnam par gus pa la lnga pa'o //
translated: pañcamamībhaktaye.🔽The fifth case is used for respect.

original: rnam par gus pa ste dad pa phul du byung ba gzhan las bkar ba'i don la rnam dbye lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par gus pa ste dad pa phul du byung ba gzhan las bkar ba'i don la rnam dbye lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: Respect, that is, the highest faith, is the meaning of the fifth case in the sense of being selected from among others.

original: au d'i tsy'a d'akshi na tye bhya:su shro tri y'a:/🔽s'a dhu ni pu n'arth'a bhy'a martsts'a y'am sapta mya pra te:/
analyzed: au d'i tsy'a d'akshi na tye bhya:su shro tri y'a:/ s'a dhu ni pu n'arth'a bhy'a martsts'a y'am sapta mya pra te:/
translated: udayacyā dakṣiṇatyebhyaḥ suśrotṛbhyaḥ.🔽sādhu ni punar arthāya mārcchāyāṃ sapta myate.

original: pra ti med pa'i mchod pa'i don la s'a dhu ni pu na dag gi bdun pa'o //🔽nye bsgyur pra ti sngon na med pa'i s'a dhu /
analyzed: pra ti med pa'i mchod pa'i don la s'a dhu ni pu na dag gi bdun pa'o // nye bsgyur pra ti sngon na med pa'i s'a dhu /
translated: The seventh case is used for the meaning of worship.

original: ni pu na dag mchod pa'i don du sbyor ba'i rtags la bdun pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: ni pu na dag mchod pa'i don du sbyor ba'i rtags la bdun pa 'gyur te /
translated: The seventh case is used for the meaning of worship when the prefix saṃ is in front of sādhu and punar.

original: m'ata ri s'a dhu:/
analyzed: m'ata ri s'a dhu:/
translated: saṃsādhuḥ.

original: m'ata ri ni pu na:/
analyzed: m'ata ri ni pu na:/
translated: saṃpunar.

original: (lho ba dang byang pa dag shin tu gus/) pra ti sbyar ba la /
analyzed: (lho ba dang byang pa dag shin tu gus/) pra ti sbyar ba la /
translated: In the case of the prefix prati,

original: s'a dhu:m'ata ram pra ti /
analyzed: s'a dhu:m'ata ram pra ti /
translated: sādhuḥ, mātaraṃ prati.

original: yang 'grel par pra ti med pa la'ang gnyis pa yang na 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: yang 'grel par pra ti med pa la'ang gnyis pa yang na 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /
translated: Moreover, the commentary explains that the second case is also used for prati.

original: s'a dhu:aa nu m'a ta ram /
analyzed: s'a dhu:aa nu m'a ta ram /
translated: sādhuḥ, anumataraṃ.

original: pra si tot+su k'a bhy'am tri t'i y'atsa /
analyzed: pra si tot+su k'a bhy'am tri t'i y'atsa /
translated: Prasitotsūkāṃ tribhir yac ca.

original: pra si ta dang aut+su ka dag gi gsum pa yang na'o //
analyzed: pra si ta dang aut+su ka dag gi gsum pa yang na'o //
translated: The third of prasita and utsūka is ya.

original: pra (ma mchod pa sdig bral /🔽ma mchod pa slar/) si ta dang aut+su ka dag gi sbyor ba la /
analyzed: pra (ma mchod pa sdig bral / ma mchod pa slar/) si ta dang aut+su ka dag gi sbyor ba la /
translated: Prasita and utsūka are combined.

original: (legs po ma la so sor/) bdun pa 'gyur zhing gsum pa'ang 'gyur te /🔽pra si to ha ri n'a /
analyzed: (legs po ma la so sor/) bdun pa 'gyur zhing gsum pa'ang 'gyur te / pra si to ha ri n'a /
translated: The seventh changes to sa and the third changes to ya.🔽Prasito hariṇaḥ.

original: pra si to ha roo /
analyzed: pra si to ha roo /
translated: Prasito haro.

original: (legs po ma la rjes su/) aut+su ko ha ri n'a /
analyzed: (legs po ma la rjes su/) aut+su ko ha ri n'a /
translated: Utsūkā hariṇaḥ.

original: aut+su ko ha roo /
analyzed: aut+su ko ha roo /
translated: Utsūkā haro.

original: naksha tre tsa lu pi /
analyzed: naksha tre tsa lu pi /
translated: Nakṣatracalupti.

original: skar ma la'ang mi mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: skar ma la'ang mi mthong ba la'o //
translated: Nakṣatracalupti means not seeing the stars.

original: skar ma las mi mthong ba'i don sbyor ba la gsum pa dang bdun pa yang na ste /🔽pu shye na gatstshe ta /
analyzed: skar ma las mi mthong ba'i don sbyor ba la gsum pa dang bdun pa yang na ste / pu shye na gatstshe ta /
translated: In the application of the meaning of not seeing the stars, the third and seventh change.🔽Puṣye nac gacchati.

original: pu shye gatstsheta /
analyzed: pu shye gatstsheta /
translated: Puṣye nac gacchati.

original: mi mthong ba'i don ma yin na gsum pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mthong ba'i don ma yin na gsum pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not mean not seeing, the third does not change.

original: pu shye sha ne:/
analyzed: pu shye sha ne:/
translated: Puṣye śane.

original: yang 'grel par lung drangs pa /
analyzed: yang 'grel par lung drangs pa /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary, a scripture is cited:

original: aa karma dh'a tu bhi:yo ge de sha k'a l'a dhva bh'a be bhya:dvi t'i y'a b'a /
analyzed: aa karma dh'a tu bhi:yo ge de sha k'a l'a dhva bh'a be bhya:dvi t'i y'a b'a /
translated: akarmadhāryoḥ, yogād deśakālādhvabhāvayoḥ, dvitaīyām.

original: byings las med pa rnams kyi sbyor ba la yul du sa lam dngos po rnams las gnyis pa yang na'o //
analyzed: byings las med pa rnams kyi sbyor ba la yul du sa lam dngos po rnams las gnyis pa yang na'o //
translated: In the combination of those without a base, the second is also from the objects, etc.

original: byings (rgyal song/) las med pa rnams kyi sbyor ba la'ang yul sogs kyi sgra la bdun (rgyal dang spen ba/) pa 'gyur zhing gnyis pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: byings (rgyal song/) las med pa rnams kyi sbyor ba la'ang yul sogs kyi sgra la bdun (rgyal dang spen ba/) pa 'gyur zhing gnyis pa'ang ngo //
translated: In the combination of those without a base, the word for object, etc., changes to the seventh, and the second is also.

original: de yang yul la /🔽na dy'am ba sa ti /
analyzed: de yang yul la / na dy'am ba sa ti /
translated: And that is in the object:🔽nadyām, vā, satyām.

original: n'i dam pa sa ti /
analyzed: n'i dam pa sa ti /
translated: nādyaṃ, satyām.🔽In time:

original: dus la / r'a trim she te /
analyzed: dus la / r'a trim she te /
translated: rātriṃ, śete.

original: r'a troo she ta /
analyzed: r'a troo she ta /
translated: rātrau, śete.

original: lam la / kro sham pa sa ti /
analyzed: lam la / kro sham pa sa ti /
translated: On the path:🔽krośaṃ, satyām.

original: kro she ba sa ti /
analyzed: kro she ba sa ti /
translated: krośe, satyām.

original: dngos po la /🔽y'a gam tishtha ti /
analyzed: dngos po la / y'a gam tishtha ti /
translated: In the thing:🔽yāgam, tiṣṭhati.

original: y'a ge tishtha ti ;🔽ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atk'a ra k'a ni sa m'apt'a:/
analyzed: y'a ge tishtha ti ; ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'atk'a ra k'a ni sa m'apt'a:/
translated: yāge, tiṣṭhati.🔽iti pāṇineḥ vyākaraṇasyādhyāyaḥ prathamaḥ samāptaḥ.

original: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las byed pa can rnams rdzogs so//
analyzed: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las byed pa can rnams rdzogs so//
translated: Thus ends the first chapter of the grammar of Panini.

original: (// chu la gnas/) de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i (nam la nyal/) bstan bcos chen po p'a (rgyang grags la gnas/) ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go (mchod sbyin la gnas/) @109b don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor
analyzed: (// chu la gnas/) de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i (nam la nyal/) bstan bcos chen po p'a (rgyang grags la gnas/) ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go (mchod sbyin la gnas/) @109b don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor
translated: examples of the rules, and so forth.

original: bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las /
translated: From the Chariot that Leads to the Jewel of Good Explanations.

original: byed pa can te rnam dbye rnams kyi 'jug tshul zhib mor ston pa las spyir btang dmigs bsal dang bcas pa rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
analyzed: byed pa can te rnam dbye rnams kyi 'jug tshul zhib mor ston pa las spyir btang dmigs bsal dang bcas pa rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: The general and specific rules for the usage of the cases have been roughly completed for the time being.

original: // / da ni tshig sdud kyi rnam gzhag 'chad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni tshig sdud kyi rnam gzhag 'chad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the presentation of the rules of sandhi will be explained.

original: sa martha: ba da bi dhi:/
analyzed: sa martha: ba da bi dhi:/
translated: samarthāḥ, vadabhidhayaḥ,

original: don sdud pa tshig gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: don sdud pa tshig gi cho ga'o //
translated: The rules of sandhi are the rules of the meaning.

original: tshig gnyis sam mang po don gcig tu sdud pa'i cho ga ston par byed pa ni tshig sdud kyi cho ga'o //🔽sa m'a sashtsa turdh'a /
analyzed: tshig gnyis sam mang po don gcig tu sdud pa'i cho ga ston par byed pa ni tshig sdud kyi cho ga'o // sa m'a sashtsa turdh'a /
translated: The rules that show the way to combine two or more words into one meaning are the rules of sandhi.🔽samāsas, caturvidhāḥ,

original: tshig sdud bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshig sdud bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of sandhi.

original: ka l'a pa /
analyzed: ka l'a pa /
translated: kalāpa,

original: tsandra pa / dbyangs can ma sogs su bsdu ba'i grangs drug tu bzhed kyang gzhung 'dir phyogs gnyis pa dang las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba gnyis de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba'i nang du bsdus te spyir btang bsdu ba'i grangs bzhi yod par bzhed la /
analyzed: tsandra pa / dbyangs can ma sogs su bsdu ba'i grangs drug tu bzhed kyang gzhung 'dir phyogs gnyis pa dang las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba gnyis de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba'i nang du bsdus te spyir btang bsdu ba'i grangs bzhi yod par bzhed la /
translated: the person. Therefore, in general, there are four types of compounds.

original: bzhi po ci zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po ci zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: mi zad pa'i bsdu ba /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i bsdu ba /
translated: The inexhaustible compound

original: de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba /
analyzed: de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba /
translated: The compound of the agent

original: 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba /🔽zlas dbye'i bsdu ba dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba / zlas dbye'i bsdu ba dang bzhi'o //
translated: The compound of many words🔽The compound of disjunction

original: de yang bsdu ba byas pa'i tshig gnyis las /
analyzed: de yang bsdu ba byas pa'i tshig gnyis las /
translated: There are two types of words that are compounded:

original: tshig snga ma brjod bya'i gtso bor gyur pa mi zad pa'i bsdu ba /
analyzed: tshig snga ma brjod bya'i gtso bor gyur pa mi zad pa'i bsdu ba /
translated: The first word is the inexhaustible compound, which is the primary🔽topic.

original: tshig phyi ma gtso bor gyur pa de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma gtso bor gyur pa de'i skyes bu'i bsdu ba /
translated: The second word is the compound of the agent, which is the primary🔽topic.🔽The two words that are directly expressed and the other primary topics

original: dngos su brjod pa gnyis po de dang 'grel ba'i don gzhan gtso bor brjod pa 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba /
analyzed: dngos su brjod pa gnyis po de dang 'grel ba'i don gzhan gtso bor brjod pa 'bru mang po'i bsdu ba /
translated: that are expressed in the commentary are the compound of many words.

original: tshig gnyis ka gtso bor gyur pa zlas dbye'i bsdu ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshig gnyis ka gtso bor gyur pa zlas dbye'i bsdu ba rnams so //
translated: The two words that are the primary topics are the compound of disjunction.

original: aa bya yam bi bhakti sa m'i pa sa mriddhi briddhyarth'a bh'a b'a tya y'a sam pra ti /🔽shabda pr'a durbh'a ba pashts'a dya th'a nu p'urbya yoo ga pa dya s'a dri shya sam patti s'a ka ly'am ta ba tsa ne shu /🔽mi zad pa rnam dbye dang nye ba dang / 'grub pa dang ; 'phel ba dang / dngos med kyi don dang / 'das pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / sgra rab tu gsal ba dang / rjes su ji lta ba dang / snga ma'i phyi ma dang /
analyzed: aa bya yam bi bhakti sa m'i pa sa mriddhi briddhyarth'a bh'a b'a tya y'a sam pra ti / shabda pr'a durbh'a ba pashts'a dya th'a nu p'urbya yoo ga pa dya s'a dri shya sam patti s'a ka ly'am ta ba tsa ne shu / mi zad pa rnam dbye dang nye ba dang / 'grub pa dang ; 'phel ba dang / dngos med kyi don dang / 'das pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / sgra rab tu gsal ba dang / rjes su ji lta ba dang / snga ma'i phyi ma dang /
translated: avyayam vibhakty-upasarga-prāpti-vṛddhi-abhāva-artha-atītā-kāla-śabda-pradhāna-ca-ady-anupūrvy-ayogapady-saṃpūrṇya-sādriśya-sakala-kalya-ādināṃ ca neṣu |🔽avyayam vibhakty-upasarga-prāpti-vṛddhi-abhāva-artha-atītā-kāla-śabda-pradhāna-ca-ady-anupūrvy-ayogapady-saṃpūrṇya-sādriśya-sakala-kalya-ādināṃ ca neṣu |🔽avyayam vibhakty-upasarga-prāpti-vṛddhi-abhāva-artha-atītā-kāla-śabda-pradhāna-ca-ady-anupūrvy-ayogapady-saṃpūrṇya-sādriśya-sakala-kalya-ādināṃ ca neṣu |

original: cig car dang / mnyam pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtha' dag dang / mtha'i tshig rnams la'o //🔽mi zad pa sogs don de rnams su pa dang supa don gcig pa'i tshig sdud can du 'gyur te de rnams kyang mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car dang / mnyam pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / mtha' dag dang / mtha'i tshig rnams la'o //🔽mi zad pa sogs don de rnams su pa dang supa don gcig pa'i tshig sdud can du 'gyur te de rnams kyang mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'i ming can du 'gyur ro //
translated: avyayam vibhakty-upasarga-prāpti-vṛddhi-abhāva-artha-atītā-kāla-śabda-pradhāna-ca-ady-anupūrvy-ayogapady-saṃpūrṇya-sādriśya-sakala-kalya-ādināṃ ca neṣu |🔽avyay

original: 'grel par / tshig mang po tshig gcig tu sbyor ba dang / aatsa du ma aatsa gcig tu sbyor ba dang / rnam dbye'i mtha' can mang po rnam dbye gcig tu @110a * //
analyzed: 'grel par / tshig mang po tshig gcig tu sbyor ba dang / aatsa du ma aatsa gcig tu sbyor ba dang / rnam dbye'i mtha' can mang po rnam dbye gcig tu @110a * //
translated: The commentary states:🔽The purpose of compounding is to compound many words into one word, many indeclinables into one indeclinable, and many words with case endings into one word with case endings.

original: sbyar bas / sngar tshig mang ba dang brjod pa ma bde ba rnams tshig nyung zhing brjod pa bde bar 'gyur ba ni tshig sdud kyi dgos pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sbyar bas / sngar tshig mang ba dang brjod pa ma bde ba rnams tshig nyung zhing brjod pa bde bar 'gyur ba ni tshig sdud kyi dgos pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, what previously was many words and difficult to express becomes few words and easy to express.

original: de rnams las dang po mi zad pa'i bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams las dang po mi zad pa'i bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Among those, I will explain the first, the compounding of the indeclinables.

original: ha roo aa dhi kri tya /
analyzed: ha roo aa dhi kri tya /
translated: Haro adhikriya.

original: zhes pa tshig sbyor ram ngag ces bya ste tshig sdud byed pa'i gzhi yin no //🔽pra tha m'a nirddishtam sa m'a sa au pa sardza nam /
analyzed: zhes pa tshig sbyor ram ngag ces bya ste tshig sdud byed pa'i gzhi yin no // pra tha m'a nirddishtam sa m'a sa au pa sardza nam /
translated: This is called a compound or phrase, and is the basis for compounding words.🔽Prathamam anirdistham samāsaupasargam.

original: dang po nges par sbyor ba'i tshig sdud nyer bsgyur ro //
analyzed: dang po nges par sbyor ba'i tshig sdud nyer bsgyur ro //
translated: The first is a compound with an indeclinable prefix.

original: rnam dbye dang po dang sbyor ba'i bsdu ba byed pa'i yul rnam dbye dang po thob pa de la nyer bsgyur zhes ming ('phrog byed bya ba lhag por/) 'dogs byed do //🔽au pa sardza nam p'urbam /
analyzed: rnam dbye dang po dang sbyor ba'i bsdu ba byed pa'i yul rnam dbye dang po thob pa de la nyer bsgyur zhes ming ('phrog byed bya ba lhag por/) 'dogs byed do // au pa sardza nam p'urbam /
translated: The first case is the object of the verbal action. The first case is called the “upasarga” (prefix).

original: nyer bsgyur sngon du'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur sngon du'o //
translated: Upasarga is before.

original: tshig sdud kyi skabs 'dir gong du nyer bsgyur zhes ming 'dogs byas pa de tshig sbyor gyi skabs mtha' dbus gang na yod kyang sngon du sbyor bar byed pas /
analyzed: tshig sdud kyi skabs 'dir gong du nyer bsgyur zhes ming 'dogs byas pa de tshig sbyor gyi skabs mtha' dbus gang na yod kyang sngon du sbyor bar byed pas /
translated: In the context of compounding, the upasarga, which was given a name above, is used before in the context of verbal composition, no matter where it is at the end or the beginning.

original: aa dhi ha roo kri tya /
analyzed: aa dhi ha roo kri tya /
translated: Adhiharoti kṛtya.

original: zhes gnas pa 'di la pr'a ti pa di ka zhes ming 'dogs byed do //🔽su po dh'a tu pr'a ti pa di ka yo:/
analyzed: zhes gnas pa 'di la pr'a ti pa di ka zhes ming 'dogs byed do // su po dh'a tu pr'a ti pa di ka yo:/
translated: This is called prātipadika.🔽Supoḍhatu prātipadikayoḥ.

original: byings pr'a ti pa di ka dag las sup kyi'o //
analyzed: byings pr'a ti pa di ka dag las sup kyi'o //
translated: From the prātipadika roots, supa is added.

original: byings dang sbyor ba dang tshig sdud kyi skabs pr'a ti pa di ka zhes ming 'dogs byas pa bsdu bya der gnas pa'i rnam dbye rnams dbyi zhing der ma zad gzhi dang / phrad dang / khyad par dang 'dra ba'i skad dod sogs tshig gi rjes 'brang rnams kyang dbyi bas ha ri la sbyin pa'i di dang kri tya phyis /
analyzed: byings dang sbyor ba dang tshig sdud kyi skabs pr'a ti pa di ka zhes ming 'dogs byas pa bsdu bya der gnas pa'i rnam dbye rnams dbyi zhing der ma zad gzhi dang / phrad dang / khyad par dang 'dra ba'i skad dod sogs tshig gi rjes 'brang rnams kyang dbyi bas ha ri la sbyin pa'i di dang kri tya phyis /
translated: In the section on the root text, application, and verbal composition, the name Prātipadikas is given. The case endings that reside in those objects to be collected are eliminated. Not only that, the following words, such as the basis, particles, distinctions, and equivalent terms in the language, are also eliminated.

original: aa dhi ha ri /
analyzed: aa dhi ha ri /
translated: The gift to Hari is adhihari.

original: de ltar rnam dbye rjes 'brang dang bcas pa phyis pas tshig sdud kyi ming thogs pa de la slar tshig tu sgrub byed kyi rnam dbye rnams 'jug pa las mtshon byed su byin /🔽aa dhi ha ri su /
analyzed: de ltar rnam dbye rjes 'brang dang bcas pa phyis pas tshig sdud kyi ming thogs pa de la slar tshig tu sgrub byed kyi rnam dbye rnams 'jug pa las mtshon byed su byin / aa dhi ha ri su /
translated: Thus, by eliminating the case endings and their following, that which is given the name of verbal composition is again given the name su by the case endings that are the means of establishing words.

original: aa bya y'i bh'a bashtsa /
analyzed: aa bya y'i bh'a bashtsa /
translated: The gift to Hari is adhihari su.🔽The state of avyayībhāva is

original: mi zad par gyur pa la'ang ngo //
analyzed: mi zad par gyur pa la'ang ngo //
translated: also for the imperishable.

original: mi zad par gyur pa ste mi zad pa sngon na yod pa mi zad pa'i bsdu ba byas pa de la rnam dbye thams cad 'jig cing bya ba yang med pas su phyis /
analyzed: mi zad par gyur pa ste mi zad pa sngon na yod pa mi zad pa'i bsdu ba byas pa de la rnam dbye thams cad 'jig cing bya ba yang med pas su phyis /
translated: The imperishable, that which exists before the imperishable, is the imperishable avyayībhāva. In that, all case endings are destroyed and there is no action, so why su?

original: de'i rjes su don ston pa'i tshig gzhan sbyor dgos te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su don ston pa'i tshig gzhan sbyor dgos te /
translated: After that, other words that indicate the meaning must be added.

original: aa dhi ha ri pra britt'a ka th'a /
analyzed: aa dhi ha ri pra britt'a ka th'a /
translated: Adhihariprativṛttākathā.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: r'a ya ma ti kr'anta /
analyzed: r'a ya ma ti kr'anta /

original: rnam dbye rjes 'bang dang bcas pa phyis /
analyzed: rnam dbye rjes 'bang dang bcas pa phyis /
translated: The case ending and the affix come after.

original: aa ti ree /
analyzed: aa ti ree /
translated: atirai.

original: zhes pa la /🔽mi zad pa'i bsdu pa'i mtha' ma ning du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa la / mi zad pa'i bsdu pa'i mtha' ma ning du 'gyur zhing /
translated: In that,🔽the final of the reduplication is elided.

original: ma ning la thung ngur 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ma ning la thung ngur 'gyur bas /
translated: The short vowel becomes a neutral vowel.🔽atiri.

original: aa ti ri/...('byor ldan/) de bzhin du /
analyzed: aa ti ri/...('byor ldan/) de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,🔽nāvamatikāntā.🔽atiṇu.

analyzed: n'a ba ma ti kr'anta la/...(gru shin tu non pa / lhag par rab tu 'phel ba'i brjod pa 'phrog byed / ches 'byor ba dang ldan pa/) aa ti nu/...(gru nu pa la khad/) de rnams mi zad @110b pa'o //
translated: In the commentary,

analyzed: 'grel par / don tshang zhing brjod bde na gong du bshad pa ltar tshig sdud kyi bya ba 'jug la don mi ston cing brjod pa mi bde na tshig sdud kyi cho ga rnams mi 'jug ste /
translated: if the meaning is complete and the expression is easy, then as explained above, the function of the reduplication applies. If the meaning is not indicated and the expression is not easy, then the rules of reduplication do not apply.🔽For example,

original: dper na / santi gu n'a:ha roo /
analyzed: dper na / santi gu n'a:ha roo /
translated: santi guṇāḥ haroḥ.

original: zhes pa lta bu la tshig sdud kyi bya ba mi 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes pa lta bu la tshig sdud kyi bya ba mi 'jug go //
translated: In the example above, the function of the compound is not applied.

original: nye ba la /
analyzed: nye ba la /
translated: In the near

original: krishna sya au pa /
analyzed: krishna sya au pa /
translated: kṛṣṇasyaupa

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: In this,

original: au pa krishna su /
analyzed: au pa krishna su /

original: n'a bya y'i bh'a b'a da to masto panytsa my'a:/
analyzed: n'a bya y'i bh'a b'a da to masto panytsa my'a:/
translated: nāvyābhāvādato 'stam pañcamayāḥ.

original: mi zad par gyur ba las aata la ma yin zhing lnga pa ma yin pa'i aa ma'o //🔽spyir btang mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'i mtha' ('phrog byed la yon tan rnams yod/) las rnam dbye thams cad 'jig par bshad (nag po'i nye ba/) kyang dmigs bsal mi zad par gyur pa las kyang aa yig mtha' can la rnam dbye rnams mi 'jig cing rnam dbye lnga
analyzed: mi zad par gyur ba las aata la ma yin zhing lnga pa ma yin pa'i aa ma'o // spyir btang mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'i mtha' ('phrog byed la yon tan rnams yod/) las rnam dbye thams cad 'jig par bshad (nag po'i nye ba/) kyang dmigs bsal mi zad par gyur pa las kyang aa yig mtha' can la rnam dbye rnams mi 'jig cing rnam dbye lnga
translated: From the non-exhaustion, the a-ending is not, and the a-ending is not the fifth.🔽In general, it is explained that all case endings are destroyed from the non-exhaustion compound,🔽but in particular, even from the non-exhaustion, the case endings are not destroyed for those ending in a-vowel, and all case endings except the fifth

original: pa rnams ma gtogs rnam dbye thams cad aam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa rnams ma gtogs rnam dbye thams cad aam du 'gyur te /
translated: become aṃ.

original: su aam / au pa krishnam /
analyzed: su aam / au pa krishnam /
translated: su aṃ, aupakṛṣṇa

original: lnga pa la /
analyzed: lnga pa la /
translated: In the fifth

analyzed: au pa krishn'a ta sogs so // tri t'i y'a sapta myorba hu lam /
translated: aupakṛṣṇāt, etc.🔽tṛtīyā saptamīyor vṛttiḥ.

original: gsum pa bdun pa dag yang na'o //
analyzed: gsum pa bdun pa dag yang na'o //
translated: The third and seventh are again.

original: gong du mi zad par gyur pa'i aa yig mtha' la rnam dbye lnga pa ma gtogs rnam dbye lhag thams cad aama du 'gyur bar bshad kyang /
analyzed: gong du mi zad par gyur pa'i aa yig mtha' la rnam dbye lnga pa ma gtogs rnam dbye lhag thams cad aama du 'gyur bar bshad kyang /
translated: Above, it was explained that all the cases except the fifth case are am at the end of the syllable a that is not exhausted.

original: mdo 'dis rnam dbye gsum (nag po nye ba/) pa dang bdun pa /
analyzed: mdo 'dis rnam dbye gsum (nag po nye ba/) pa dang bdun pa /
translated: However, this sūtra states that the third case and the seventh case

original: (nag po nye ba las/) dag aama du 'gyur ba dang spyir btang aa thung mtha' can gyi bya ba gnyis ka 'jug pas 'dam ka can du bya ste /🔽gsum pa la /
analyzed: (nag po nye ba las/) dag aama du 'gyur ba dang spyir btang aa thung mtha' can gyi bya ba gnyis ka 'jug pas 'dam ka can du bya ste / gsum pa la /
translated: are am and that both the short a and the two actions at the end are applied, so it is to be done optionally.

original: au pa krishne na /🔽au pa krishnam /🔽bdun pa la /🔽au pa krishne /
analyzed: au pa krishne na / au pa krishnam / bdun pa la / au pa krishne /
translated: The third case is like upākriṣṇe.🔽The seventh case is like upākriṣṇam.🔽The seventh case is like upākriṣṇe.

original: au pa krishnam lta bu'o //
analyzed: au pa krishnam lta bu'o //
translated: The seventh case is like upākriṣṇam.

original: 'grub pa la /
analyzed: 'grub pa la /
translated: In the case of the perfect tense,

original: ma dr'a n'am sa mri dhi:/
analyzed: ma dr'a n'am sa mri dhi:/
translated: it is madrāṇāṃ samṛddhiḥ.

original: zhes pa la gong bzhin rnam dbye rnams bsdus sa mriddhi'i don nyer bsgyur su sngon /
analyzed: zhes pa la gong bzhin rnam dbye rnams bsdus sa mriddhi'i don nyer bsgyur su sngon /
translated: As above, the cases are contracted. The meaning of samṛddhi is a prefix su in front.

original: su ma dram /
analyzed: su ma dram /
translated: It is sumadram.

original: yang 'grel par mi zad par gyur pa'i aa yig mtha' (nye bar nag po yis/) can yin kyang su ma dra dang / (nye ba nag po la/) aunmatta gang+ga la bdun pa rnams (dge ba rnams kyi 'grub pa/) aam nyid du 'gyur gyi yang na ba mi byed do //
analyzed: yang 'grel par mi zad par gyur pa'i aa yig mtha' (nye bar nag po yis/) can yin kyang su ma dra dang / (nye ba nag po la/) aunmatta gang+ga la bdun pa rnams (dge ba rnams kyi 'grub pa/) aam nyid du 'gyur gyi yang na ba mi byed do //
translated: Also, the commentary says that although the syllable a is inexhaustible, it becomes sumadra, unmatta, and ganggala when the seventh case is added, but it does not become any other.🔽

original: zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas /
translated: The Subcommentary explains:🔽Although the letter a is inexhaustible, it becomes sumadra,🔽unmatta, and gangga when the seventh case is added,🔽but it does not become am.🔽Therefore:🔽sumadra🔽unmatta gangga

original: ngi la / (dge ba bzang po/) su ma dram /
analyzed: ngi la / (dge ba bzang po/) su ma dram /
translated: yama nā nāṃ bṛddhiḥ🔽In the above, the case ending is elided as before. The prefix dur is added to the meaning of the indeclinable bṛddhi.🔽dur+bṛddhi🔽dur+yā

original: aunmatta gang+gam/...(gangg'a smyon pa la/) 'phel ba la /
analyzed: aunmatta gang+gam/...(gangg'a smyon pa la/) 'phel ba la /
translated: pa+naṃ🔽In the above, the case ending is elided as before. The prefix dur is added to the meaning of the indeclinable bṛddhi.🔽dur+bṛddhi

original: ya ma n'a n'am briddhi:/...(kla klo rnams kyi 'phel ba/) zhes pa la /
analyzed: ya ma n'a n'am briddhi:/...(kla klo rnams kyi 'phel ba/) zhes pa la /
translated: dur+yā🔽pa+naṃ

original: gong bzhin rnam dbye bsdus priddhi'i don nyer bsgyur dur sngon /
analyzed: gong bzhin rnam dbye bsdus priddhi'i don nyer bsgyur dur sngon /
